alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 10 at 9:26PM MST until June 12 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR THE YAVAPAI MOUNTAINS, COCONINO AND KAIBAB PLATEAUS, AND THE LITTLE COLORADO RIVER VALLEY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR ALL OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... * AFFECTED AREA...For Sunday...locations near Dilkon, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, Kykotsmovi, Page, Prescott, Seligman, Tuba City and Valle. This includes portions of the Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest, Prescott National Forest and Tonto National Forest. For Monday, all of northern Arizona. * WINDS...On Sunday, southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. On Monday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 12%. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Check weather.gov/flagstaff for updates and livingwithfire.info for preparedness tips. Please notify field crews of this Fire Weather Watch.
